elements.name: User Responsibilites
elements.text:
User Responsibilities:

The assigned user is considered the "custodian" of the vehicles/equipment, and is responsible to ensure:

  • All operators of vehicles/equipment are properly qualified and have a valid driver's license, as applicable, ensuring that the equipment is operated within the specifications identified by the manufacturer, performing operations fluid checks, and complying with all applicable procedures for safe operation.

  • Generators & Light Towers are subject to certain AOP requirements. Rental equipment program is not able to support adherence to AOP requirements, consult your ECO for assistance.

  • Light Towers & Generators will be grounded prior to operation.

  • Vehicles and equipment shall not be modified in any way. Attachments not authorized by the manufacturer, vendor, or Fleet Management shall not be utilized.

  • In the event of damage or mechanical issues (trouble lights, tire replacement, cracked windshields, rock chips, etc.) custodian will contact Fleet Management for further direction. Costs attendant to any damage to the vehicles/equipment, beyond normal wear and tear, will be the responsibility of the renting organization.

    • Light Duty Vehicles - 376-5730
    • Equipment and commercial trucks/trailers - 376-4656 or 372-1799

  • When notified by Fleet Management that service is required (oil changes, recalls, etc.), custodian will schedule the service to be performed as soon as possible.

  • Refuel on road vehicles a minimum of once per month, inputting an accurate odometer reading at the pump.

  • When vehicles/equipment are no longer needed, notify Fleet Management. Vehicles/equipment shall be returned in a clean condition, with a full tank of fuel, any spare keys, and the fuel card, if applicable.

  • For equipment rentals, custodian must contact HMIS Motor Carrier Services to receive fuel if needed.
